page.title: 06SCHOOLING
page.content:
In 1985 Castle Carrock school,with 3 teachers, had 55 pupils on its roll: 17 from the village itself, 5 others from the Talkin area, and the remainder from the fellside villages and farms outside the Doomesday study area. Transport has to be provided by the Local Education Authority. Due to the distances travelled, shool dinners have to be provided. At the age of 11 all pupils have to travel to the senior school at Brampton.
For pre-school age children, there is a playgroup, run mainly by the parents, which meets three times a week in the Watson Institute.
The former village school in Talkin has been converted to a centre for Brownie holidays and weekends.
